alert.note: Alert for Anchorage (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 16 at 3:07AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...Anchorage. * WHEN...Until 900 AM AKDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 302 AM AKDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.25-0.5 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.3 to 0.7 inches are possible. At 3 am, rainfall rates of 0.2 to 0.3 inches per hours are occurring across northern and western Anchorage and is expected to continue for at least the next hour. - For Campbell Creek near Dimond: At 2:15am the stage was 19.7 feet. Flood Stage is 20.5 feet. For Chester Creek at Arctic Blvd: At 2:15am the stage was 4.53 feet. Flood Stage is 4.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 5.0 feet is expected by 9:00am Wednesday. Impacts: At 22.0 feet: Flooding of bike path along Campbell Creek from Lake Otis to Victor/Dimond. Jim`s Burgers floods. Water in the yard of residence just upstream of Campbell Campbell Creek and Dowling. At 4.0 feet: Portions of the Chester Creek Bike Path will get inundated, especially beneath the C St Bridge - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
